meanings.definition: The set of all possible values that a function can output.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned about codomains and how they represent all the possible outcomes of a function.
meanings.sent2: The codomains of the function include all the different results it can give.
meanings.sent3: The codomains of the function were like a treasure chest full of answers waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast landscape, with the codomains of functions scattered like hidden gems.
meanings.sent5: Understanding codomains is like holding the key to unlocking the mysteries of functions.

meanings.definition: The set of all possible second elements in a relation.
meanings.sent1: When studying relations, we must consider the codomains to understand all the possible second elements.
meanings.sent2: The codomains in the relation show the range of second elements that can be paired.
meanings.sent3: The codomains in the relation were like a collection of puzzle pieces waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a map, with the codomains of relations marking the different paths of his emotions.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing the codomains helps in picturing the full scope of the relation.
